newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's Santos reducing rates for Mercosur cargo.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's Santos reducing rates for Mercosur cargo.

text.p: Brazil's key port of Santos is reducing fees in order to encourage more cargo movement within Brazil and with its partners in the Mercosur customs union, the port authority Codesp said.
"Codesp is adopting new tariff reduction measures to increase cargo movement in some parts of Santos port...initiating work to transform Santos into a hub port," it said in a statement.
In some sections of the port, the so-called operational infrastructure fee will be cut by 10 percent, Codesp said.
Rental fees for cranes will be cut, and vessels docked at warehouses seven to 12 will benefit from a higher priority when the product is destined for a Brazilian or Mercosur port, it added.
The Mercosur groups Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay while Chile and Bolivia are associate members.
All measures will apply to vessels docking between June 1 and August 31.
Santos port is scheduled to be privatized later this year.
